Package controller

Class addProductForm

java.lang.Object
controller.addProductForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class addProductForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This controller class allows to add Product object to the ObservableList allProducts of the Inventory class and to add or delete associated part(s) to a product.

The addProductForm class implements the Initializable interface. Provides control to the flow of data into objects and updates the addProductForm FXML file.

Author:
Myriam Drouin-Sagar

  • Constructor Details

      public addProductForm()

  • Method Details

    • onSearchPart

      public void onSearchPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches a part by id first, and then by partial or full name.

      Gets the value from the searchPartText text field. This method catches a NumberFormatException: if a string is found, the method will search for the partial name. If the text field searchPartText is empty, the table view is repopulated with all the parts.

      If a part is found by id, the part object is highlighted in the table view. If a part is found by name, the part object is filtered in the table view. If not part is found an information message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Search button searchPartButton clicked by the user or passed from the keyEvent (never used)

    • onSearchPartText

      public void onSearchPartText(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Calls the onSearchPart action event. This method allows the user to initiate the search with the keyboard (ENTER) and to empty the parts' table view search text field (backSpace).
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The event generated when the user press the ENTER button on the keyboard and the focus is on the Search text field searchPartText

    • onAddAssocPart

      public void onAddAssocPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Associates a part with the new product. It adds the part selected by the user in the table view partsPane3> to the table view AssociatedPartsPane.

      This is done by calling the add method to append the part at the end of the ObservableList associatedParts.

      If no part is selected, an error message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Add button addAssocPartButton when clicked by the user (never used)

    • onRemoveAssocPart

      public void onRemoveAssocPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Dissociates a part from the new product. It removes the associated part selected by the user in the table view AssociatedPartsPane.

      This is done by calling the remove method to remove the part from the ObservableList associatedParts.

      If no part is selected, an error message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Remove Associated Part button removeAssocPartButton when clicked by the user (never used)

    • onCancelAddProduct

      public void onCancelAddProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Cancels the addProductForm and returns to the mainForm.

      It displays a confirmation dialog box. If confirmed, a call to the function returnToMainScreen will redirect the user to the mainForm.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Cancel button cancelAddPartButton when clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLLoader in the method returnToMainScreen

    • onSaveProduct

      public void onSaveProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Gets and saves a new Product and its values entered by the user in the addProductForm and loads the mainForm.

      It adds the new Product object to the ObservableList allProducts by calling the addProduct method of the Inventory class. It also adds associated part(s) to the ObservableList associateParts by calling the addAssociatedPart method of the Product class.

      A call to the minMaxValid method and invValid method is also made, and error messages are displayed if min or inv is not valid. An error message is also displayed if the name field is empty.

      NumberFormatException to catch invalid values (string in an int text field) or an empty text field. If caught, an error message is displayed.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by the Save button saveAddProductButtonwhen clicked by the user
      Throws:
      IOException - from the FXMLoader in the method returnToMainScreen

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      First method to run in this class, and populates the tables views. The initialize method is implemented by the Initializable class.

      Called when the FXMLoader calls the addPartForm FXML file.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the location used to retrieve relative paths for the root object (null if location unknown)
      resourceBundle - the resources used to localize the root object (null if root object not localized)
